title: Sustainable HR Strategy: People Strategy, Culture & Values
overview: Establishing your organization's strategy, desired culture, and core values is foundational work. These elements significantly influence how stakeholders perceive your company and how connected employees feel to the organization. Implementing sustainable approaches creates a meaningful cultural differentiator for attracting and retaining talent.

solutions.title: Develop Communication & Engagement Tools
solutions.description: Once your strategy and values are defined, establish regular communication channels and employee involvement mechanisms. Emphasize consistency and simplicity in your approach.
internal_communications: Create straightforward employee engagement surveys to gauge satisfaction and expectations; track progress through periodic measurement
Encourage staff to voice concerns and contribute ideas for maximum feedback quality
Conduct monthly leadership and staff meetings to share updates
Designate specific leaders/employees as progress reporters; use visual displays in offices or internal platforms as reminders
Establish employee-led initiatives; one example is forming a Green Team
external_communications: Identify internal initiatives suitable for market communication to attract aligned candidates
Consider communicating sustainable practices to clients, particularly as many larger organizations now assess partner/supplier engagement through sustainability questionnaires

solutions.title: Include Sustainability in Code of Conduct
solutions.description: Embed your values into organizational handbooks and codes of conduct to demonstrate their importance.
key_elements: Advance inclusion, equity, and respectful values with a sustainability focus
Establish policies protecting rights and wellbeing of vulnerable workforce segments, including migrant workers, aging employees, and workers with disabilities

solutions.title: Define Sustainable HR Analytics
solutions.description: If you don't measure it, you can't manage it. Develop a focused metrics framework aligned with your strategy.
implementation_guidance: Select limited metrics to maintain focus and prevent dilution of results
Ensure metrics are easily gathered, measurable, and comprehensible; automation is preferable when feasible
Assign clear responsibility for data collection and establish reporting cadence
Hold leadership/management accountable for progress and outcomes
Define baseline values, targets, and timelines
Determine which metrics to share company-wide versus management-only and which to publish externally (CSR/sustainability reports)
Create engaging, straightforward, impactful metrics encouraging broad participation

solutions.title: Build a Sustainable Team - BASIC
solutions.description: Green Teams, CSR Task Forces, and Sustainability Teams accelerate and amplify organizational sustainability efforts through various naming conventions and structures.
setup_recommendations: Think across departmental lines; identify a leader from each relevant department
Select an executive-level sponsor to advocate for the team's initiatives
Officially allocate time for sustainability work within employee job descriptions and objectives rather than treating it as additional responsibility
If capacity is limited, engage external consultants to provide part-time sustainability management
Progress toward dedicated full-time Sustainability Manager positions and allocated budgets as demands increase
solutions.guiding_principle: If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together (African proverb)
